<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/10/facebook-apple-spar-lawmakers-encryption?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Can Facebook and Apple Keep a Secret?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="encrypted phone" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc2MDE0ODQ5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Like <em>The Crown</em> periodically reminds us of the oddities of the British monarchy, government officials periodically remind us of the ethical dilemma of encryption when they <a href="https://www.axios.com/encryption-facebook-apple-senators-lindsey-graham-d489b991-3db2-41c6-a6d8-102f0bd8c553.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">drag</a> tech leaders into their mahogany halls. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Cut to yesterday</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">First, Facebook <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/12/10/tech/facebook-doj-encryption/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">denied</a> Attorney General Bill Barr’s proposal to add “back doors” for law enforcement to access encrypted messages. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>FB is planning to add end-to-end encryption to services like Messenger (WhatsApp is already encrypted). </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In October, Barr </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2019/10/07/us-uk-australia-ask-facebook-halt-endtoend-encryption-push?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sent a letter</a></span><span> asking the company to delay those plans. It was cosigned by the U.K.’s and Australia’s top law enforcement officials. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Also yesterday, Facebook and Apple privacy execs defended their encryption practices before the Senate Judiciary Committee.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Encryption makes communications more private and secure...but that presents major hurdles for law enforcement looking for evidence. Both Democratic and Republican senators threatened to pass legislation mandating back doors if the tech giants don't develop them on their own. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Some U.S. senators and Barr argued that Facebook and Apple </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-encryption-facebook/u-s-senators-threaten-facebook-apple-with-encryption-regulation-idUSKBN1YE2CK?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">are aiding</a></span><span> criminals by allowing private communications that can’t be accessed with a warrant. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>With 1.5 billion users, WhatsApp may be the world’s most widely used encrypted messenger.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Even Manhattan District Attorney Cy Vance Jr. took the Northeast Regional down to D.C. to join the pile-on. He said encryption “effectively upended centuries of American jurisprudence.” </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Tech’s side of the story </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Facebook responded to Barr by claiming his proposal would be a “gift to criminals, hackers, and repressive regimes.” Apple’s manager for user privacy said there’s no way to create back doors that “only work for the good guys,” adding, “They will be exploited by nefarious entities as well.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Both companies have clashed with lawmakers over privacy before, but for different reasons. Apple <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2016/12/03/504130977/a-year-after-san-bernardino-and-apple-fbi-where-are-we-on-encryption?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">encountered</a> a similar encryption dilemma when it tried to deny the FBI access to the San Bernardino shooter’s iPhone in 2016. Facebook has been criticized for its slip-ups in keeping private user info private.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRADE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/10/house-democrats-trump-reach-usmca-agreement?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
It's Pronounced OOH-Smih-Kuh
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Nancy Pelosi at USMCA press conference " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc2MDA4MDU2LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Saul Loeb/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The same morning House Democrats announced <a href="https://apnews.com/bb81279725b6f810d5792502254f2f88?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">two articles of impeachment</a> against President Trump, they also <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/10/house-democrats-and-trump-administration-reach-usmca-trade-deal.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reached an agreement</a> with the White House to push forward with USMCA, the North American trade deal replacing Nafta. That’s like hugging someone right as you knee them in the crotch. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why do Democrats support USMCA?</strong> Because...it almost looks like a <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/01/us/politics/trump-trade-deal-usmca.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Democrat wrote it</a>, especially the sections that enforce tougher labor standards. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Even the AFL-CIO, a leading federation of unions that initially held its nose at the deal, came around following recent revisions: “There is no denying that the trade rules will now be fairer,” President Richard Trumka said. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>The OG Nafta was a landmark 1994 free trade deal signed by the U.S., Canada, and Mexico. It had critics and defenders, but lawmakers on both sides of the aisle agreed it was time for a 21st century paint job.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That time came yesterday afternoon when representatives from Canada, Mexico, and the Trump administration signed the new agreement. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Congress will <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-12-10/house-democrats-plan-usmca-vote-as-pelosi-lauds-revised-deal?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">vote on the deal</a> starting next week.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Pop quiz: </strong>What does USMCA stand for? (Answer at bottom.)</p>

<tr>

</a><span>  </span>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CLIMATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/10/exxon-wins-big-climate-change-case?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Exxon Legal Team Breaks for Holiday R&R
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A New York judge cleared ExxonMobil of <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/07/exxon-mobil-ready-close-climate-change-case?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">claims</a> it downplayed climate change risks to investors and cost them up to $1.6 billion. We give John Grisham ’til February. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Judge Barry Ostrager <a href="https://www.npr.org/2019/12/10/780317799/exxon-wins-new-york-climate-change-case?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> the court was <em>not</em> absolving Exxon of contributing to climate change. But under the scope of a securities fraud case, the New York attorney general couldn’t meet the burden of proof. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it’s a big deal: </strong>This was the second climate change lawsuit to reach trial in the U.S. and was viewed as a bellwether for future attempts to hold oil and gas companies accountable.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">After the holidays, it’s back to business</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Fossil fuel companies are bracing for a wave of <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/d5fbeae4-869c-11e9-97ea-05ac2431f453?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">climate change litigation</a>. Exxon’s already <a href="https://www.wbur.org/earthwhile/2019/10/25/maura-healey-exxon-climate-change-lawsuit?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">facing</a> similar claims from the Massachusetts AG.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Cities in Maryland, Rhode Island, Colorado, and more are trying to leverage “<a href="https://www.latimes.com/business/story/2019-11-15/exxons-climate-change-trial?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">public nuisance</a>” lawsuits, while other localities are seeking compensation for mitigation costs tied to climate change.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Many states and activists are <a href="https://www.vox.com/energy-and-environment/2019/2/22/17140166/climate-change-lawsuit-exxon-juliana-liability-kids?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hoping</a> for a 1998 Master Settlement Agreement moment, when Big Tobacco agreed to pay $206+ billion to states.</p>

TOURISM
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/10/tourism-operators-fire-following-fatal-volcano-eruption?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

Not the Blast You Want on Vacation

</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="white island volcano " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc2MDEzNDI0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Image by <a href="https://pixabay.com/users/Eisi02q-1001197/?utm_source=link-attribution&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=image&utm_content=2940034" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Eisi02q</a> from <a href="https://pixabay.com/?utm_source=link-attribution&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=image&utm_content=2940034" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Pixabay</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some tourists like flirting with danger. But the fatal eruption of a New Zealand volcano has set off a debate over whether tour operators need more limits.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What happened: </strong>A volcano on White Island erupted Monday with an estimated 47 tourists on its shores. Early reports confirmed six deaths and 30 injuries. Fear of another eruption has <a href="https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/pkeeem/rescuers-cant-get-to-new-zealand-volcano-victims-because-theyre-afraid-of-another-eruption?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">slowed</a> the efforts of first responders. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The gray area: </strong>White Island is <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/12/10/asia/white-island-new-zealand-tourism-intl-hnk/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">privately owned</a> by a family trust that gives tour companies and visitors permission to take volcano selfies. More than 10,000 people visit annually. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Could this have been prevented?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">White Island visitors generally sign waivers acknowledging the risks, but some legal experts <a href="https://www.stuff.co.nz/business/118085368/whakaariwhite-island-tour-operators-cant-waiver-their-way-out-of-safety-obligations?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">question</a> whether that paperwork absolves tour companies of their obligations to the safety of employees and clients.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Tourism businesses are incentivized to boost foot traffic above all else. Overcrowding has led to fatal accidents at popular sites like </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/outlook/mount-everest-is-packed-whose-fault-is-that/2019/05/31/de7b3888-8349-11e9-9a67-a687ca99fb3d_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Mount Everest</a></span><span> and the </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/06/11/world/europe/budapest-danube-crash.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Danube</a></span><span> river. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>At White Island, tours were happening even after the volcano’s alert level was </span><span><a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-50710998?intlink_from_url=https://www.bbc.com/news/topics/c55wgp504dpt/new-zealand-volcano&link_location=live-reporting-story&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raised</a></span><span> last month.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>New Zealand police and workplace safety authorities are <a href="https://twitter.com/WorkSafeNZ/status/1204250033782083584?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">looking</a> into the incident.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRANSPORTATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/10/ebike-company-adds-helmets-improve-safety?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Wheels Wants People to Stop Using Their Heads
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Wheels scooters with helmets " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc2MDEzMzI4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Image courtesy of Wheels</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The micromobility company Wheels has <a href="https://www.axios.com/scooters-bikes-head-injuries-helmet-41874459-f95c-43f8-adf5-9a9cdb2a8770.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">redesigned</a> its e-bikes to include a shareable helmet that riders can access for free. For those concerned about the hygienic implications of communal headgear, each helmet comes equipped with a removable liner. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The problem: </strong>Most urban commuters are more worried about their hairdo than being turned into skull soup. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In a </span><span><a href="https://www.austintexas.gov/sites/default/files/files/Health/Epidemiology/APH_Dockless_Electric_Scooter_Study_5-2-19.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">study</a></span><span> of e-scooter injuries in Austin, TX, the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention found that 48% were head injuries. And how many of the 190 injured riders were wearing a helmet? Just one. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Another study </span><span><a href="https://jamanetwork.com/journals/jamanetworkopen/fullarticle/2722574?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a></span><span> that head injuries accounted for over 40% of e-scooter-related ER visits. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory on Wheels: </strong>1) It was <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2019/12/10/21003734/wheels-electric-bike-bikeshare-helmet-redesign-included?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">started</a> earlier this year by the brothers who cofounded the dog-walking startup Wag 2) it operates bike-shares in six U.S. cities and Stockholm, Sweden, and 3) it’s raised almost $100 million since launching. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Shared bikes and e-scooters are <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2019/04/17/shared-electric-scooter-rides-accounted-for-45-8-percent-of-all-micromobility-trips-in-2018/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">jumping in popularity</a>. But to become a mainstay in cities, companies will have to address safety concerns.</p>

<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Private real estate investing is now for the public</strong></span><span>, thanks to </span><span><a href="https://fundrise.com/acq-plus/start?utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morningbrew&utm_campaign=breakroom-20191211&utm_content=all" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Fundrise</a></span><span>. <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Yesterday, Merriam-Webster released its Word of the Year for 2019.</strong> We’re not going to tell you what it is. Here we go. </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“It reflects a surprising fact: Even a basic term—a personal pronoun—can rise to the top of our data.”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“English famously lacks a gender-neutral singular pronoun to correspond neatly with singular pronouns like </span><span><em>everyone</em></span><span> or </span><span><em>someone</em></span><span>.”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“More recently, though, _______ has also been used to refer to one person whose gender identity is nonbinary.”</span></li>

style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nCan Facebook and Apple Keep a Secret?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"encrypted phone\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc2MDE0ODQ5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLike \u003cem\u003eThe Crown\u003c/em\u003e periodically reminds us of the oddities of the British monarchy, government officials periodically remind us of the ethical dilemma of encryption when they \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/encryption-facebook-apple-senators-lindsey-graham-d489b991-3db2-41c6-a6d8-102f0bd8c553.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edrag\u003c/a\u003e tech leaders into their mahogany halls. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eCut to yesterday\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFirst, Facebook \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2019/12/10/tech/facebook-doj-encryption/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edenied\u003c/a\u003e Attorney General Bill Barr’s proposal to add “back doors” for law enforcement to access encrypted messages. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFB is planning to add end-to-end encryption to services like Messenger (WhatsApp is already encrypted). \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn October, Barr \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2019/10/07/us-uk-australia-ask-facebook-halt-endtoend-encryption-push?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esent a letter\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e asking the company to delay those plans. It was cosigned by the U.K.’s and Australia’s top law enforcement officials. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAlso yesterday, Facebook and Apple privacy execs defended their encryption practices before the Senate Judiciary Committee.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eEncryption makes communications more private and secure...but that presents major hurdles for law enforcement looking for evidence. Both Democratic and Republican senators threatened to pass legislation mandating back doors if the tech giants don't develop them on their own. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eSome U.S. senators and Barr argued that Facebook and Apple \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-encryption-facebook/u-s-senators-threaten-facebook-apple-with-encryption-regulation-idUSKBN1YE2CK?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eare aiding\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e criminals by allowing private communications that can’t be accessed with a warrant. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWith 1.5 billion users, WhatsApp may be the world’s most widely used encrypted messenger.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEven Manhattan District Attorney Cy Vance Jr. took the Northeast Regional down to D.C. to join the pile-on. He said encryption “effectively upended centuries of American jurisprudence.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eTech’s side of the story \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFacebook responded to Barr by claiming his proposal would be a “gift to criminals, hackers, and repressive regimes.” Apple’s manager for user privacy said there’s no way to create back doors that “only work for the good guys,” adding, “They will be exploited by nefarious entities as well.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eBoth companies have clashed with lawmakers over privacy before, but for different reasons. Apple \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2016/12/03/504130977/a-year-after-san-bernardino-and-apple-fbi-where-are-we-on-encryption?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eencountered\u003c/a\u003e a similar encryption dilemma when it tried to deny the FBI access to the San Bernardino shooter’s iPhone in 2016. Facebook has been criticized for its slip-ups in keeping private user info private.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereached an agreement\u003c/a\u003e with the White House to push forward with USMCA, the North American trade deal replacing Nafta. That’s like hugging someone right as you knee them in the crotch. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy do Democrats support USMCA?\u003c/strong\u003e Because...it almost looks like a \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/01/us/politics/trump-trade-deal-usmca.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eDemocrat wrote it\u003c/a\u003e, especially the sections that enforce tougher labor standards. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEven the AFL-CIO, a leading federation of unions that initially held its nose at the deal, came around following recent revisions: “There is no denying that the trade rules will now be fairer,” President Richard Trumka said. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eThe OG Nafta was a landmark 1994 free trade deal signed by the U.S., Canada, and Mexico. It had critics and defenders, but lawmakers on both sides of the aisle agreed it was time for a 21st century paint job.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat time came yesterday afternoon when representatives from Canada, Mexico, and the Trump administration signed the new agreement. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eCongress will \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-12-10/house-democrats-plan-usmca-vote-as-pelosi-lauds-revised-deal?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evote on the deal\u003c/a\u003e starting next week.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ Pop quiz: \u003c/strong\u003eWhat does USMCA stand for? style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSome tourists like flirting with danger. But the fatal eruption of a New Zealand volcano has set off a debate over whether tour operators need more limits.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat happened: \u003c/strong\u003eA volcano on White Island erupted Monday with an estimated 47 tourists on its shores. Early reports confirmed six deaths and 30 injuries. Fear of another eruption has \u003ca href=\"https://www.vice.com/en_us/article/pkeeem/rescuers-cant-get-to-new-zealand-volcano-victims-because-theyre-afraid-of-another-eruption?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eslowed\u003c/a\u003e the efforts of first responders. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe gray area: \u003c/strong\u003eWhite Island is \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2019/12/10/asia/white-island-new-zealand-tourism-intl-hnk/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eprivately owned\u003c/a\u003e by a family trust that gives tour companies and visitors permission to take volcano selfies. More than 10,000 people visit annually. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eCould this have been prevented?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhite Island visitors generally sign waivers acknowledging the risks, but some legal experts \u003ca href=\"https://www.stuff.co.nz/business/118085368/whakaariwhite-island-tour-operators-cant-waiver-their-way-out-of-safety-obligations?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003equestion\u003c/a\u003e whether that paperwork absolves tour companies of their obligations to the safety of employees and clients.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eTourism businesses are incentivized to boost foot traffic above all else. Overcrowding has led to fatal accidents at popular sites like \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/outlook/mount-everest-is-packed-whose-fault-is-that/2019/05/31/de7b3888-8349-11e9-9a67-a687ca99fb3d_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eMount Everest\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e and the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/06/11/world/europe/budapest-danube-crash.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eDanube\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e river. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAt White Island, tours were happening even after the volcano’s alert level was \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-50710998?intlink_from_url=https://www.bbc.com/news/topics/c55wgp504dpt/new-zealand-volcano\u0026link_location=live-reporting-story\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eraised\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e last month.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eNew Zealand police and workplace safety authorities are \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/WorkSafeNZ/status/1204250033782083584?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elooking\u003c/a\u003e into the incident.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe micromobility company Wheels has \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/scooters-bikes-head-injuries-helmet-41874459-f95c-43f8-adf5-9a9cdb2a8770.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eredesigned\u003c/a\u003e its e-bikes to include a shareable helmet that riders can access for free. For those concerned about the hygienic implications of communal headgear, each helmet comes equipped with a removable liner. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe problem: \u003c/strong\u003eMost urban commuters are more worried about their hairdo than being turned into skull soup. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.austintexas.gov/sites/default/files/files/Health/Epidemiology/APH_Dockless_Electric_Scooter_Study_5-2-19.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estudy\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of e-scooter injuries in Austin, TX, the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention found that 48% were head injuries. And how many of the 190 injured riders were wearing a helmet? Just one. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAnother study \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://jamanetwork.com/journals/jamanetworkopen/fullarticle/2722574?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereported\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e that head injuries accounted for over 40% of e-scooter-related ER visits. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory on Wheels: \u003c/strong\u003e1) It was \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2019/12/10/21003734/wheels-electric-bike-bikeshare-helmet-redesign-included?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estarted\u003c/a\u003e earlier this year by the brothers who cofounded the dog-walking startup Wag 2) it operates bike-shares in six U.S. cities and Stockholm, Sweden, and 3) it’s raised almost $100 million since launching. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eShared bikes and e-scooters are \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2019/04/17/shared-electric-scooter-rides-accounted-for-45-8-percent-of-all-micromobility-trips-in-2018/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ejumping in popularity\u003c/a\u003e.
